intro: Seseli aemulans, commonly known as the mimic seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often growing in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
